data.meta_description: Apr 14, 2024 - Bindusara was a 3rd-century BCE Indian emperor who succeeded Chandragupta Maurya as the ruler of the Mauryan Empire. He expanded his territory by conquering most of India, except for the southernmost regions. He is also known for his religious tolerance, and his support of various sects and schools of thought. He was the father of Ashoka, one of the most famous and influential emperors in Indian history.   Consider supporting our work by leaving a donation on the following UPI ID -   renukasakshi10@okicici   #bindusara #chandraguptamaurya #mauryanempire #indianhistory #indianking #artwork #chanakya
